txt.en: <rgb=#00FF00>Sit</rgb> with Raphûz by the fire
Listen to Raphûz's story
Smoke with Raphûz's device
'My mother was Umbari, and my father was Shagâni. They met in the lower docks of the city.'
Listen to Raphûz's story
'We lived a wonderful life. My father died years ago, naturally. My mother followed him within the past several months.'
'Before she passed, she bid me return to my father's homeland to restore his name.'
'That story is best saved for another time.'
'I am grateful for your assistance, [placeholder]. When I lost my pack, I thought I would lose my post and shame my family. Now, I question whether I should leave my post of my own accord.'
'Why, you ask? I saw a woman back on the road before Telperiën's wall. It is why I stopped and ventured away from the caravan.'
Listen to Raphûz's story
Join Raphûz by the fire.
'My mother warned of the visions and voices of Shagâna as she lay on her deathbed.'
'Not even a week out of Umbar, I see my first vision. Lose the pack I need for my livelihood and try to hide it.'
'You must think me a fool.'
Over tea and a smoke, Raphûz tells you why he joined the Tale-wardens and recalls the story of his family.
Raphûz offers a seat by the fire.
Join Raphûz by the fire
Continue conversing with Raphûz.
Listen to Raphûz's story
Raphûz suggested you share his tobacco.
Conclude your discussion with Raphûz
'I began this journal as a boy. They are the stories of my mother and father. I hoped to fill it with stories of my own.'
'It is because of your actions I still have this opportunity.'
'I am sorry I cannot offer you more than a sad story from a confused young man, a smoke, and some tea for your efforts.'
'We are here to observe and preserve. How can I uphold my promise if I am only to observe?'
'...and now a woman haunts my waking moments.'
'Not a woman I have met, but a beauty I saw only from afar whose freedom stirs me deeply.'
'My father fled Shagâna in disgrace. I pledged to my mother I would restore his name.'
<rgb=#00FF00>Bow</rgb> to Raphûz and take your leave
'...and whose appearance nearly cost me my dearest possession.'
'I took work with the Phetekâri because I had no other means to travel here.'
'I expected the work would keep me busy enough while I learned what I could of my father and how I could restore his name.'
'The training was not hard but came with warnings of what we may face in Shagâna. Little is known of the people, my father's people.'
'We know the Ordâkhai hold - held power here until the temples fell in Umbar, and now my father's people rebel against the Ordâkhai.'
You used Raphûz's hookah, but the experience is different than smoking with your pipe.
You continue listening to Raphûz's story. You should share a smoke with him using your pipe.
Raphûz smiled as you approached and asked you to join him
The evening grows long. Perhaps it is time to retire.
DNT - Replace this with the teleport out
'I have spoken and kept you from your business long enough. Thank you for this opportunity. Speak with me again so I may wish you well on your journeys.'
'You saw the vision too? Maybe it was no vision.'
Raphûz smiles as you approach, 'Please, come and sit by my fire.'
'I wanted to talk to her. I wanted to ask her why she stood so far from the caravan. Was she following us? Watching us? Why?'
'As I strayed, my mother's voice came into my head. \qBe wary of the voices in Shagâna. They will tempt you. They will make you wander and follow them to your death.\q'
'As I drew near, I saw she looked beautiful but fierce. Akin to a storm in the summer.'
'I heard a call from the caravan and turned. Kizeri beckoned me to return to the caravan.'
<rgb=#00FF00>Cough</rgb> at Raphûz, alerting him to your difficulty with his device
'When I turned back. The woman was gone.'
'I thought it was my mother's tale made manifest.'
<rgb=#00FF00>Smoke</rgb> with Raphûz
Instance: A Promise Kept
Tell Raphûz you do not think him a fool with <rgb=#00FF00>no</rgb>
